message.content: Most women in Benin have a negative perception of divorce. They generally view it as a last resort and believe that marriage is a lifelong commitment. Women often prioritize maintaining the stability of their families and the well-being of their children over personal happiness. Divorce is seen as a social stigma and can lead to judgment and exclusion from the community. Additionally, women may face financial difficulties and social challenges after divorce, making them hesitant to pursue it.
